alert.note: Alert for Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Eastern Culberson County; Reeves County Plains; Van Horn and Highway 54 Corridor (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 26 at 8:44PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN REEVES...NORTH CENTRAL JEFF DAVIS AND EASTERN CULBERSON COUNTIES THROUGH 930 PM CDT... At 844 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 26 miles north of Kent, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Kent and Plateau. This includes Interstate 10 between mile markers 157 and 176. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
